basics.name: Nikhil Reddy Billa

basics.summary: Graduate Student at Virginia Tech and  Machine learning Researcher.Ex Software Engineer at NCR Corporation

work.name: NCR Corporation
work.summary: Leveraged C# expertise to diagnose and resolve issues at Grocery and Fuel POS, ensuring optimal system functionality and a positive user experience.Additionally, developed new features to address evolving business requirements.

Research.organization: ML Lab, International Institute of Information Technology (IIIT) Hyderabad
summary: Working on deploying fully autonomous navigation systems on the road to detect objects under adverse weather conditions and in unstructured traffic.
Working on the safety and robustness of semantic segmentation models.
Developed simulation-based Labs for Discrete Mathematics course

awards.title: People Choice Award

publications.name: CNN based image resizing forensics for double compressed JPEG images
publications.publisher: Elsevier, Journal of Information Security and Applications
publications.summary: This paper investigates a novel CNN-based architecture for image resizing forensics in the presence of Double-JPEG compression.

publications.name: IDD-AW: A Benchmark for Safe and Robust Segmentation of Drive Scenes in Unstructured Traffic and Adverse Weather
publications.publisher: IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision
publications.summary: We introduce the IDD-AW dataset, which provides 5000 pairs of high-quality images with pixel-level annotations, captured under rain, fog, low light, and snow in unstructured driving conditions. As compared to other adverse weather datasets, we provide i.) more annotated images, ii.) paired Near-Infrared (NIR) image for each frame, iii.) larger label set with a 4-level label hierarchy to capture unstructured traffic conditions. We benchmark state-of-the-art models for semantic segmentation in IDD-AW. We also propose a new metric called 'Safe mean Intersection over Union (Safe mIoU)' for hierarchical datasets which penalizes dangerous mispredictions that are not captured in the traditional definition of mean Intersection over Union (mIoU).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
